title: Quiz 3: Medical Surgical Nursing 2024
description: Comprehensive quiz covering Medical-Surgical Nursing, Theatre Nursing, and Specialized Procedures from the 2024 NCK Licensure Paper 1.

questions.question: A patient with a history of chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD) is experiencing respiratory distress. Which nursing intervention is the priority for managing the patient's respiratory status?

options.text: Administering bronchodilators
Positioning the patient in high Fowler's position
Performing chest physiotherapy
Administering oxygen therapy

questions.explanation: High Fowler's position optimizes lung expansion and reduces the work of breathing, making it a priority nursing intervention.

questions.question: A patient post-thyroidectomy develops signs of hypocalcemia, including tingling around the mouth and muscle cramps. Which action should the nurse take first?

options.text: Administer oral calcium supplements
Notify the healthcare provider
Assess the patient's calcium level
Encourage increased intake of dairy products

questions.explanation: Symptomatic hypocalcemia is an emergency requiring immediate medical intervention (e.g., IV calcium).

questions.question: A patient with a history of heart failure presents with dependent edema in the lower extremities. Which nursing action is most appropriate for managing the patient's edema?

options.text: Applying compression stockings
Elevating the legs above heart level
Administering diuretics as prescribed
Encouraging increased fluid intake

questions.explanation: Leg elevation promotes venous return and reduces hydrostatic pressure.

questions.question: A patient with a history of diabetes mellitus is admitted with a foot ulcer. Which nursing intervention is essential for preventing infection in the foot ulcer?

options.text: Applying topical antibiotics
Performing daily wound debridement
Keeping the ulcer covered with a sterile dressing
Administering oral antibiotics prophylactically

questions.explanation: A sterile dressing acts as a barrier against pathogens.

questions.question: A patient with a history of cirrhosis is at risk for developing hepatic encephalopathy. Which nursing intervention is most effective in preventing and managing hepatic encephalopathy?

options.text: Administering lactulose as prescribed
Restricting dietary protein intake
Monitoring serum ammonia levels
Encouraging increased fluid intake

questions.explanation: Lactulose reduces ammonia levels by trapping it in the gut.

questions.question: A patient with a history of stroke is at risk for impaired skin integrity due to immobility. Which nursing intervention is most effective in preventing pressure ulcers in this patient?

options.text: Turning and repositioning the patient every 2 hours
Massaging bony prominences regularly
Applying heating pads to areas of erythema
Using a pressure-reducing mattress

questions.explanation: Regular repositioning relieves pressure and restores perfusion.

questions.question: A patient with a history of chronic kidney disease is prescribed a low-phosphorus diet. Which dietary choice indicates understanding of the prescribed diet?

options.text: Grilled chicken breast
Cheese omelet
Whole wheat toast with peanut butter
Spinach salad with almonds

questions.explanation: Dairy, nuts, and whole grains are high in phosphorus. Chicken is lower in comparison.

questions.question: A patient with a history of peptic ulcer disease is prescribed proton pump inhibitors (PPIs) for ulcer healing. Which information is important for the nurse to include in patient education about PPI therapy?

options.text: PPIs should be taken on an empty stomach.
PPIs should be discontinued once symptoms resolve.
PPIs may increase the risk of gastrointestinal bleeding.
PPIs should be taken with antacids for optimal effect.

questions.question: A patient with a history of chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD) is prescribed a metered-dose inhaler (MDI) with a spacer. Which instruction should the nurse include in the demonstration of MDI use?

options.text: Inhale slowly and deeply while pressing the canister.
Exhale completely before inhaling the medication.
Shake the inhaler vigorously before each puff.
Hold the breath for 10 seconds after inhaling the medication.

questions.question: A patient with a history of type 2 diabetes mellitus is prescribed insulin glargine (Lantus) once daily. Which statement indicates understanding of insulin glargine administration?

options.text: I will inject insulin glargine 30 minutes before meals.
I will shake the insulin vial vigorously before drawing the dose.
I will rotate injection sites within the same body region.
I will administer insulin glargine with a rapid-acting insulin.

questions.question: A patient with a history of heart failure is prescribed digoxin. Which assessment finding indicates a potential adverse effect of digoxin therapy?

options.text: Bradycardia
Hypotension
Hyperkalemia
Confusion

questions.explanation: Bradycardia is a classic sign of toxicity.

questions.question: A patient with a history of coronary artery disease is prescribed aspirin for antiplatelet therapy. Which information is important for the nurse to include in patient education about aspirin therapy?

options.text: Take aspirin with a full glass of milk to minimize gastrointestinal upset.
Avoid using nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drugs (NSAIDs) while taking aspirin.
Discontinue aspirin therapy if you develop a fever.
Take aspirin on an empty stomach for better absorption.

questions.explanation: NSAIDs interfere with aspirin's antiplatelet effect and increase bleeding risk.

questions.question: A patient with a history of stroke is prescribed clopidogrel (Plavix) for secondary prevention of thrombotic events. Which laboratory test should the nurse monitor closely during clopidogrel therapy?

options.text: Prothrombin time (PT)
Activated partial thromboplastin time (aPTT)
Platelet count
International normalized ratio (INR)

questions.question: A patient with a history of chronic kidney disease is prescribed erythropoietin-stimulating agents (ESAs) for anemia management. Which parameter should the nurse monitor closely during ESA therapy?

options.text: Serum potassium levels
Hemoglobin levels
Serum creatinine levels
White blood cell count

questions.explanation: Monitor Hb to prevent cardiovascular risks.

questions.question: A patient with a history of chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD) is prescribed prednisone for an acute exacerbation. Which instruction is important for the nurse to include in patient education about prednisone therapy?

options.text: Take prednisone with antacids to minimize gastrointestinal upset.
Avoid abruptly stopping prednisone therapy.
Increase your intake of potassium-rich foods while taking prednisone.
Prednisone may cause weight loss, so monitor your weight regularly.

questions.question: A patient with a history of chronic kidney disease is prescribed a low-protein diet. Which dietary choice indicates understanding of the prescribed diet?

options.text: Grilled salmon
Lentil soup
Beef stew
Chicken Caesar salad

questions.explanation: A salad generally has less total protein than meat-heavy dishes or legumes.

questions.question: A patient with a history of deep vein thrombosis (DVT) is prescribed warfarin therapy. Which instruction is essential for the nurse to include in patient education about warfarin therapy?

options.text: Limit your intake of green leafy vegetables.
Avoid activities that may increase your risk of bleeding.
Take a double dose if you miss a dose to catch up.
Report any unusual bleeding or bruising to your healthcare provider.

questions.question: A patient with a history of chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD) is prescribed tiotropium (Spiriva) inhaler. Which instruction should the nurse include in patient education about tiotropium inhaler use?

options.text: Use the inhaler only when you experience symptoms.
Rinse your mouth with water after each use.
Exhale forcefully before inhaling the medication.
Store the inhaler in the refrigerator between uses.

questions.explanation: Exhaling first allows for deep inhalation.

questions.question: A patient with a history of myocardial infarction is prescribed atorvastatin for lipid-lowering therapy. Which parameter should the nurse monitor closely during atorvastatin therapy?

options.text: Serum potassium levels
Liver function tests
Blood glucose levels
Serum sodium levels

questions.question: A patient with a history of heart failure is prescribed lisinopril for blood pressure management. Which adverse effect is most commonly associated with lisinopril therapy?

options.text: Hyperkalemia
Hypertension
Dry cough
Bradycardia

questions.question: A patient with a history of peptic ulcer disease is prescribed famotidine (Pepcid) for gastric acid suppression. Which instruction should the nurse include in patient education about famotidine therapy?

options.text: Take famotidine on an empty stomach.
Avoid taking antacids while on famotidine therapy.
Increase your intake of spicy foods while taking famotidine.
Notify your healthcare provider if you develop black, tarry stools.

questions.explanation: Black tarry stools indicate GI bleeding.

questions.question: A patient with a history of stroke is prescribed aspirin and clopidogrel for dual antiplatelet therapy. Which nursing intervention is essential for preventing bleeding complications in this patient?

options.text: Administering proton pump inhibitors (PPIs) concomitantly
Encouraging increased fluid intake
Monitoring for signs of thrombocytopenia
Providing education on fall prevention measures

questions.explanation: Preventing falls reduces the risk of severe hemorrhage.

questions.question: A patient with a history of chronic kidney disease is prescribed phosphate binders. Which instruction should the nurse include in patient education about phosphate binder therapy?

options.text: Take phosphate binders with meals.
Avoid taking phosphate binders with calcium supplements.
Increase your intake of foods high in phosphorus.
Take phosphate binders on an empty stomach.

questions.explanation: Binders work on food in the stomach.

questions.question: A patient with a history of coronary artery disease is scheduled for coronary artery bypass graft (CABG) surgery. Which preoperative nursing intervention is essential for preparing the patient for surgery?

options.text: Administering aspirin to prevent thrombosis
Providing education about postoperative pain management
Assisting the patient with deep breathing and coughing exercises
Obtaining informed consent for the surgical procedure

questions.question: A patient with a history of heart failure is prescribed a beta-blocker. Which assessment finding indicates a therapeutic effect of beta-blocker therapy?

options.text: Decreased heart rate
Increased blood pressure
Elevated respiratory rate
Worsening dyspnea

questions.question: During a surgical procedure, the nurse notices a sudden decrease in the patient's oxygen saturation on the monitor. What immediate action should the nurse take?

options.text: Inform the surgeon and anesthesiologist
Increase the flow rate of oxygen
Check the endotracheal tube placement
Assess the patient's respiratory status

questions.question: Before transferring the patient to the operating room (OR), the nurse notices a discrepancy between the surgical consent form and the planned procedure. What should the nurse do?

options.text: Proceed with the planned procedure
Inform the patient about the discrepancy
Consult the surgeon for clarification
Document the discrepancy in the patient's chart

questions.question: During a surgical procedure, the nurse observes excessive bleeding from the surgical site. What intervention should the nurse prioritize?

options.text: Apply pressure to the bleeding site
Administer intravenous fluids rapidly
Notify the surgeon immediately
Request blood products from the blood bank

questions.explanation: Communication ensures the surgeon is aware and can act.

questions.question: After positioning the patient for surgery, the nurse notices signs of pressure injury on the patient's heels. What should the nurse do?

options.text: Apply pressure-relieving devices to the heels
Document the findings in the patient's chart
Reposition the patient to relieve pressure
Notify the surgeon about the pressure injuries

questions.question: While preparing the surgical instruments for sterilization, the nurse notices visible residue on some of the instruments. What action should the nurse take?

options.text: Re-sterilize the instruments
Use the instruments for the procedure as they are
Document the findings in the instrument log
Notify the sterile processing department

questions.question: During surgery, the nurse notices an abnormal heart rhythm on the patient's cardiac monitor. What is the nurse's priority action?

options.text: Administer antiarrhythmic medication
Assess the patient's vital signs and symptoms
Document the rhythm in the patient's chart
Inform the anesthesiologist immediately

questions.question: After the surgical procedure, the nurse assists with transferring the patient to the post-anesthesia care unit (PACU). What information should the nurse provide to the PACU nurse?

options.text: Details of the surgical procedure
Intraoperative complications and interventions
Patient's preoperative vital signs and laboratory results
Plan for postoperative pain management

questions.question: While preparing the operating room (OR) for a surgical procedure, the nurse notices a malfunctioning anesthesia machine. What is the nurse's priority action?

options.text: Use an alternative anesthesia machine
Document the malfunction in the equipment log
Inform the anesthesia provider immediately
Continue with the surgical procedure as scheduled

questions.explanation: Faulty equipment is a safety hazard.

questions.question: During surgery, the nurse notices a discrepancy between the surgical count and the number of instruments on the sterile field. What should the nurse do?

options.text: Re-count the instruments on the sterile field
Document the discrepancy in the surgical count log
Continue with the procedure as planned
Inform the surgical team and initiate a thorough search

questions.question: After administering anesthesia to the patient, the nurse notices a sudden drop in blood pressure. What is the nurse's priority action?

options.text: Administer vasopressors to increase blood pressure
Assess the patient's airway, breathing, and circulation
Document the blood pressure readings in the anesthesia record
Notify the anesthesiologist immediately

questions.question: During surgery, the nurse observes a sudden change in the patient's level of consciousness. What is the nurse's immediate action?

options.text: Administer a reversal agent for anesthesia
Document the change in the patient's chart
Check the patient's vital signs
Notify the anesthesia provider immediately

questions.explanation: Awareness under anesthesia is an emergency.

questions.question: While positioning the patient for surgery, the nurse notices that the patient's skin is not adequately protected from pressure injuries. What should the nurse do?

options.text: Apply a pressure-relieving device to the bony prominences
Document the observation in the preoperative checklist
Reposition the patient to alleviate pressure on vulnerable areas
Continue with the positioning as planned

questions.question: While preparing the surgical site, the nurse notices that the skin preparation solution has expired. What should the nurse do?

options.text: Use the expired solution as it is still effective
Document the expiration date in the patient's chart
Discard the expired solution and obtain a new one
Dilute the solution with sterile water to extend its shelf life

questions.question: During the surgical procedure, the nurse notices a break in sterile technique by a member of the surgical team. What should the nurse do?

options.text: Document the break in sterile technique in the surgical log
Continue with the procedure and address the issue later
Inform the surgeon immediately and request corrective action
Report the incident to the hospital's quality assurance department

questions.question: After the surgical procedure, the nurse assists with transferring the patient to the post-anesthesia care unit (PACU). What information should the nurse provide to the PACU nurse?

options.text: Details of the surgical procedure and anesthesia administration
Patient's allergies and medication history
Patient's vital signs and intraoperative complications
Plan for postoperative pain management and discharge instructions

questions.explanation: Basic procedural details are fundamental to handover.

questions.question: While preparing the surgical instruments for sterilization, the nurse notices that the autoclave is not reaching the required temperature. What should the nurse do?

options.text: Document the issue in the equipment log and continue with sterilization
Adjust the settings on the autoclave to increase the temperature
Notify the sterile processing department and request maintenance
Use an alternative method of sterilization for the instruments

questions.question: During surgery, the nurse observes an unusual odor emanating from the surgical site. What should the nurse do?

options.text: Document the observation in the patient's chart
Ignore the odor and continue with the procedure
Inform the surgeon immediately and assess for signs of infection
Request additional suctioning to remove the odor

questions.explanation: Odor can indicate infection or necrosis.

questions.question: After the surgical procedure, the nurse assists with applying the surgical dressing. What is the nurse's priority action?

options.text: Documenting the dressing change in the patient's chart
Assessing the surgical incision for signs of complications
Providing instructions to the patient about wound care
Ensuring that the dressing is applied securely and correctly

questions.question: During the surgical procedure, the nurse notices a discrepancy between the patient's identification bracelet and the surgical consent form. What should the nurse do?

options.text: Proceed with the procedure as planned
Document the discrepancy in the patient's chart
Inform the surgeon and anesthesia provider immediately
Request clarification from the patient and family members

questions.question: While preparing the operating room (OR) for a surgical procedure, the nurse notices a spill of bodily fluids on the floor. What is the nurse's priority action?

options.text: Clean up the spill using appropriate infection control measures
Document the spill in the environmental services log
Place warning signs to alert others about the spill
Continue with the preparation of the OR as planned

questions.question: During surgery, the nurse notices that the patient's blood pressure is trending higher than the baseline. What action should the nurse take?

options.text: Administer antihypertensive medication
Document the blood pressure readings in the anesthesia record
Notify the anesthesia provider for further assessment
Continue monitoring the patient's blood pressure closely

questions.question: While positioning the patient for surgery, the nurse notices that the patient's arms are not adequately padded. What should the nurse do?

options.text: Proceed with the positioning as planned
Document the observation in the patient's chart
Apply soft padding to the patient's arms to prevent pressure injuries
Inform the surgeon about the inadequate padding

questions.question: After the surgical procedure, the nurse assists with transferring the patient to the post-anesthesia care unit (PACU). What information should the nurse provide to the PACU nurse?

options.text: Patient's intraoperative vital signs and hemodynamic parameters
Details of the surgical procedure and anesthesia administration
Plan for postoperative pain management and analgesic medications
Documentation of the surgical count and instrument inventory

questions.explanation: Vitals trends are critical for PACU monitoring.

questions.question: During surgery, the nurse notices that the patient's temperature is dropping below the normal range. What should the nurse do?

options.text: Increase the ambient room temperature in the operating room
Administer a warming blanket or forced-air warming device
Document the temperature trend in the patient's chart
Continue monitoring the patient's temperature closely

questions.question: While preparing the operating room (OR) for a surgical procedure, the nurse notices that the surgical instrument tray is incomplete. What should the nurse do?

options.text: Proceed with the procedure using the available instruments
Document the missing instruments in the surgical count log
Inform the sterile processing department and request additional instruments
Borrow the missing instruments from another OR

questions.explanation: Ensure a complete set for safety.

questions.question: A nurse is preparing to perform a tracheostomy tube change for a patient. What action should the nurse prioritize to ensure patient safety during the procedure?

options.text: Using sterile technique during the tube change
Administering sedation to the patient before the procedure
Skipping the suctioning step to minimize patient discomfort
Changing the tracheostomy ties after completing the tube change

questions.question: A nurse is preparing to perform a wound irrigation procedure for a patient with a contaminated wound. What solution should the nurse use for wound irrigation?

options.text: Sterile water
Normal saline
Hydrogen peroxide
Betadine solution

questions.explanation: Normal saline is isotonic and safe.

questions.question: A nurse is preparing to perform a urinary catheterization for a patient. What action should the nurse take to ensure proper insertion technique?

options.text: Inserting the catheter without using sterile gloves
Using aseptic technique and sterile equipment during catheter insertion
Performing catheterization without using lubricating jelly
Advancing the catheter rapidly to minimize patient discomfort

questions.question: A nurse is preparing to administer a nasogastric (NG) tube feeding for a patient. What action should the nurse prioritize before initiating tube feeding?

options.text: Verifying the NG tube placement by auscultating for bowel sounds
Securing the NG tube to prevent dislodgement during feeding
Checking the patency of the NG tube by aspirating gastric contents
Elevating the head of the bed to a semi-Fowler's position

questions.question: A nurse is preparing to perform a central venous catheter (CVC) dressing change for a patient. What action should the nurse prioritize to minimize the risk of infection?

options.text: Wearing sterile gloves and a mask during the dressing change
Cleaning the insertion site with alcohol-based antiseptic solution
Removing the old dressing and applying a new dressing using sterile technique
Changing the CVC tubing along with the dressing to prevent contamination

questions.explanation: Mask and sterile gloves are standard.

questions.question: A nurse is preparing to perform a bedside bronchoscopy procedure for a patient. What action should the nurse take to ensure patient safety during the procedure?

options.text: Administering sedation to the patient before the bronchoscopy
Obtaining informed consent from the patient or their legal representative
Skipping the use of topical anesthesia to minimize patient discomfort
Allowing the patient to eat or drink up to one hour before the procedure

questions.question: A nurse is preparing to assist with a lumbar puncture procedure for a patient. What action should the nurse take to maintain procedural asepsis?

options.text: Wearing sterile gloves and a surgical mask during the procedure
Cleansing the puncture site with povidone-iodine solution
Using a sterile drape to cover the patient during the procedure
Avoiding unnecessary movement or talking during the procedure

questions.question: A nurse is preparing to assist with a cardiopulmonary resuscitation (CPR) procedure for a patient in cardiac arrest. What action should the nurse prioritize during the initial assessment?

options.text: Administering oxygen via nasal cannula at 2 liters per minute
Checking for responsiveness and calling for help immediately
Placing the patient in the recovery position to facilitate breathing
Assessing the patient's airway, breathing, and circulation (ABCs)

questions.question: A nurse is preparing to perform a chest tube insertion for a patient with a pneumothorax. What action should the nurse prioritize to ensure proper placement of the chest tube?

options.text: Positioning the patient in a semi-Fowler's position with arms elevated
Marking the insertion site with a pen to guide tube placement
Administering analgesia to the patient before the procedure
Confirming the insertion site and direction using imaging guidance

questions.question: A nurse is preparing to perform a wound debridement procedure for a patient with a necrotic wound. What action should the nurse prioritize to minimize patient discomfort during the procedure?

options.text: Administering systemic analgesia before the procedure
Using sharp debridement techniques to minimize manipulation
Applying a topical anesthetic cream to the wound site
Performing the debridement procedure quickly to reduce duration

questions.question: A nurse is preparing to assist with a peripherally inserted central catheter (PICC) insertion for a patient. What action should the nurse prioritize to maintain procedural asepsis?

options.text: Wearing sterile gloves and a surgical mask during the procedure
Cleansing the insertion site with alcohol-based antiseptic solution
Using a sterile drape to cover the patient during the procedure
Avoiding unnecessary movement or talking during the procedure

questions.question: A nurse is preparing to perform an intramuscular (IM) injection for a patient. What action should the nurse take to ensure proper injection technique?

options.text: Selecting a small-gauge needle to minimize patient discomfort
Administering the injection rapidly to reduce patient anxiety
Aspirating the syringe to confirm needle placement before injection
Inserting the needle at a 90-degree angle into the muscle

questions.question: A nurse is preparing to perform a bladder catheterization for a patient with urinary retention. What action should the nurse prioritize to minimize the risk of infection?

options.text: Using sterile gloves and a surgical mask during catheterization
Cleansing the perineal area with povidone-iodine solution before catheter insertion
Administering prophylactic antibiotics before the catheterization procedure
Using aseptic technique and sterile equipment during catheter insertion

questions.question: A nurse is preparing to perform a gastric lavage procedure for a patient with gastrointestinal bleeding. What action should the nurse prioritize to ensure procedural effectiveness?

options.text: Administering antacid medication to the patient before the procedure
Using lukewarm water for gastric lavage to avoid thermal injury
Limiting the lavage fluid volume to prevent fluid overload
Positioning the patient in a left lateral decubitus position during lavage

questions.question: A nurse is preparing to assist with a bone marrow biopsy procedure for a patient. What action should the nurse prioritize to ensure patient comfort during the procedure?

options.text: Administering intravenous sedation to the patient before the biopsy
Providing distraction techniques such as music or relaxation exercises
Applying a topical anesthetic cream to the biopsy site
Allowing the patient to eat or drink up to one hour before the procedure

questions.explanation: Sedation helps with the pain of aspiration.

questions.question: A nurse is preparing to assist with a thoracentesis procedure for a patient with pleural effusion. What action should the nurse prioritize to ensure procedural safety?

options.text: Administering pre-procedure antibiotics to prevent infection
Ensuring the patient empties their bladder before the procedure
Positioning the patient upright with arms supported on a bedside table
Confirming the patient's informed consent before the procedure

questions.explanation: Upright position expands the intercostal spaces.

questions.question: A nurse is preparing to perform a continuous bladder irrigation (CBI) procedure for a patient following urological surgery. What action should the nurse prioritize to prevent complications during CBI?

options.text: Adjusting the irrigation flow rate based on the patient's urine output
Changing the irrigation solution every 24 hours to maintain sterility
Using tap water for irrigation to prevent electrolyte imbalances
Limiting the duration of CBI to minimize the risk of bladder distention

questions.explanation: Adjust rate to keep urine clear/pink.

questions.question: A nurse is preparing to assist with a lumbar epidural steroid injection (LESI) procedure for a patient with chronic back pain. What action should the nurse prioritize to ensure procedural accuracy?

options.text: Confirming the patient's identity and procedure site using two identifiers
Positioning the patient in a prone position with a pillow under the abdomen
Providing conscious sedation to the patient to minimize discomfort
Administering local anesthesia to the skin before needle insertion

questions.question: A nurse is preparing to assist with a transesophageal echocardiogram (TEE) procedure for a patient. What action should the nurse prioritize to ensure patient safety during TEE?

options.text: Placing the patient in a supine position with arms at their sides
Administering intravenous sedation to the patient before the procedure
Instructing the patient to refrain from eating or drinking for six hours before the procedure
Ensuring the availability of emergency equipment and resuscitation medications

questions.explanation: Safety equipment must be ready for sedation complications.

questions.question: A nurse is preparing to perform a colposcopy procedure for a patient with abnormal cervical cytology results. What action should the nurse prioritize to enhance patient comfort during colposcopy?

options.text: Administering intravenous sedation to the patient before the procedure
Explaining the procedure steps and providing emotional support to the patient
Applying a topical anesthetic cream to the cervix before colposcopy
Allowing the patient to have a support person present during the procedure

questions.question: A nurse is preparing to perform an intracranial pressure (ICP) monitoring procedure for a patient with traumatic brain injury. What action should the nurse prioritize to ensure procedural accuracy?

options.text: Ensuring proper zeroing and calibration of the ICP monitoring system
Positioning the patient in a high-Fowler's position during the procedure
Administering prophylactic antibiotics to prevent infection
Placing the ICP monitor in the subarachnoid space via lumbar puncture

questions.question: A nurse is preparing to assist with a cardiopulmonary exercise stress test for a patient. What action should the nurse prioritize to ensure patient safety during the test?

options.text: Administering a beta-blocker medication to the patient before the test
Monitoring the patient's electrocardiogram (ECG) rhythm continuously during the test
Encouraging the patient to consume a heavy meal two hours before the test
Allowing the patient to resume normal activities immediately after the test

questions.question: A nurse is preparing to assist with a magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) procedure for a patient. What action should the nurse prioritize to ensure procedural safety?

options.text: Screening the patient for contraindications to MRI, such as metal implants or claustrophobia
Administering intravenous sedation to the patient before the procedure
Placing the patient in a supine position with arms at their sides during the MRI scan
Allowing the patient to wear metallic jewelry or accessories during the procedure

questions.explanation: Screening for metal is a critical safety step.

questions.question: A nurse is preparing to assist with a transurethral resection of the prostate (TURP) procedure for a patient with benign prostatic hyperplasia (BPH). What action should the nurse prioritize to prevent fluid overload during TURP?

options.text: Monitoring the patient's serum electrolyte levels during the procedure
Administering diuretic medications to the patient before the procedure
Limiting the duration of irrigation fluid instillation during TURP
Adjusting the irrigation fluid temperature to promote hemostasis

questions.explanation: Limiting irrigation helps prevent TURP syndrome.

questions.question: A nurse is preparing to assist with a percutaneous endoscopic gastrostomy (PEG) tube insertion for a patient requiring long-term enteral feeding. What action should the nurse prioritize to ensure procedural success?

options.text: Confirming the patient's fasting status before the PEG tube insertion
Positioning the patient in a supine position with the head of the bed elevated
Administering prophylactic antibiotics to prevent infection
Coordinating with radiology or gastroenterology for procedural guidance
